titre: Bluetongue virus was detected in Europe
contenu: Tridge LogoGlobal trading platform Tridge Get a demo Sign In News Bluetongue virus was detected in Europe Lamb Meat Belgium Other Policies Germany +6 Published Oct 16, 2023 Tridge summary The bluetongue virus has been detected in Germany after previously being found in the Netherlands and Belgium. The virus was diagnosed in a sheep on a farm near the Dutch border, leading to quarantine measures. The virus, which mainly affects cattle, sheep, and goats, is spread by midges and causes severe symptoms in sheep. Disclaimer:The above summary was generated by Tridge's proprietary AI model for informational purposes. Original content After the Netherlands and Belgium, the bluetongue virus was also detected in Germany. The competent authorities diagnosed the disease in a sheep on a farm near the Dutch border. According to the tests, the other animals on the farm show no signs of illness, regardless of this, quarantine was ordered. The disease causes serious economic damage in the region, as North Rhine-Westphalia loses its disease-free status - and this means trade restrictions in relation to animal species susceptible to bluetongue. The first cases of the current wave were detected in August on sheep farms in Spain, and then discovered by the Dutch authorities at the beginning of September. Typically, the presence of the virus was detected on sheep farms, and today nearly 40 livestock farms are affected in North Holland and the province of Utrecht. However, animals have already tested positive for the virus on some cattle farms. The virus serotype 3 is responsible for the disease in the region, which produces ... resume_50_mots: Le bluetongue virus a été détecté en Allemagne après des cas signalés aux Pays-Bas et en Belgique.
resume_100_mots: Le bluetongue virus, qui affecte principalement les bovins, les ovins et les caprins, a été détecté sur une ferme allemande près de la frontière néerlandaise. La maladie a entraîné des mesures de quarantaine, ce qui peut avoir des conséquences économiques importantes pour la région.
resume_150_mots: Le bluetongue virus, une maladie causée par un virus transmis par les moustiques, avait déjà été détecté aux Pays-Bas et en Belgique. La maladie a maintenant été identifiée sur une ferme allemande, ce qui a conduit à des mesures de quarantaine pour empêcher la propagation du virus. Les conséquences économiques de cette maladie sont importantes, car elle peut affecter la qualité de la viande et avoir un impact sur les échanges commerciaux avec d'autres pays.
